comments.author: caillon@redhat.com
comments.creator: caillon@redhat.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 525911
screenshot of Seamonkey in the GNOME 3 application chooser

I can only seem to find a max of 48px icons for seamonkey and seamonkey-mail included in the tarballs.  On GNOME 3, this doesn't really look that nice...  icons are displayed in larger sizes so the icons look somewhat blurry.  Please include a 256px icon, which is the size expected by GNOME 3.

Hopefully this can also be added to the stable 2.0.x series.
comments.raw_text:
I can only seem to find a max of 48px icons for seamonkey and seamonkey-mail included in the tarballs.  On GNOME 3, this doesn't really look that nice...  icons are displayed in larger sizes so the icons look somewhat blurry.  Please include a 256px icon, which is the size expected by GNOME 3.

Hopefully this can also be added to the stable 2.0.x series.

comments.text: KaiRo, I presume that you have a suitable 256px icon available, and did you ever put the high resolution SVG images somewhere in the tree?
comments.raw_text: KaiRo, I presume that you have a suitable 256px icon available, and did you ever put the high resolution SVG images somewhere in the tree?
comments.creator: philip.chee@gmail.com
comments.author: philip.chee@gmail.com

comments.creator: antoine.mechelynck@gmail.com
comments.text:
In reply to comment #1:
There is a 256px icon (used by the about: page) at <appdir>/chrome/icons/default/seamonkey.png in an installed build of SeaMonkey.
comments.raw_text:
In reply to comment #1:
There is a 256px icon (used by the about: page) at <appdir>/chrome/icons/default/seamonkey.png in an installed build of SeaMonkey.
comments.author: antoine.mechelynck@gmail.com

comments.creator: antoine.mechelynck@gmail.com
comments.text: ah, no sorry, that seamonkey.png is a 256px icon but the about: page (and about:logo) use a different image.
comments.raw_text: ah, no sorry, that seamonkey.png is a 256px icon but the about: page (and about:logo) use a different image.
comments.author: antoine.mechelynck@gmail.com
kairo@kairo.at
comments.creator: kairo@kairo.at
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> KaiRo, I presume that you have a suitable 256px icon available, and did you
> ever put the high resolution SVG images somewhere in the tree?

We never completely cleared up trademark implications of that, so we never published SVGs or high-res PNGs, but someone should really clear that up, as I'd like to make available all the artwork I created to the complete community, if possible, esp. as someone else probably will need to work on those things in the future.
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> KaiRo, I presume that you have a suitable 256px icon available, and did you
> ever put the high resolution SVG images somewhere in the tree?

We never completely cleared up trademark implications of that, so we never published SVGs or high-res PNGs, but someone should really clear that up, as I'd like to make available all the artwork I created to the complete community, if possible, esp. as someone else probably will need to work on those things in the future.

comments.author: philip.chee@gmail.com
comments.text:
> We never completely cleared up trademark implications of that, so we never
> published SVGs or high-res PNGs, but someone should really clear that up,

IANAL. Can you post to the council mailing list summarizing the legat stuff so that someone can pick up on that? Perhaps cc mozilla-legal as well.

comments.text:
For the mail window you can use the SVG at:
<http://mxr.mozilla.org/comm-central/source/suite/branding/nightly/icons/svg/messengerWindow.svg>
To generate a 256px icon. Not sure where to place it.
KaiRo can you generate a 256px PNG for the GNOME3 chooser?

comments.raw_text: I pointed Philip and a few others how to get to the raw data, if we figure out the legal stuff here and anyone from the SeaMonkey core team need access to files for this, please contact me on IRC.
